node.title: Meet Global Execs and Founders from Asia and the US at STEP Digital 2020.
node.content:
Erica Kerner and Melissa Rosenthal are just two of the speakers joining the STEP Digital global line-up at STEP 2020 this year.

Erica Kerner is the Sr. Advisor at ONE Championship, Asia's largest Sports Media Property. She was also the VP of Marketing & Comms at Tiffany & Co. The Asia Pacific, as part of her more than 20 years of experience with other companies like Ralph Lauren, Adidas, Nike and more in the Asia Pacific (she's an expert on China!).

Melissa Rosenthal, also joining the STEP Digital line-up, hails from the US. She was part of Cheddar, a live video media company, acquired by Altice USA for $200M. She's now co-founded Inspo, a text-tech publishing network. 

Get your STEP Digital ticket now for only $115 or if you want access to all 4 conferences including the Main Stage, get your Master Pass Early Bird ticket here!
node.categories: STEP 2020|Blog>Content & Speakers|2020 conference agenda Old>STEP Digital

node.title: Jeremiah Owyang is speaking at STEP 2020.
node.content:
Jeremiah Owyang is taking the Main Stage at STEP 2020. Jeremiah focuses on how disruptive tech powers the collaborative economy. He's the founder of Crowd Companies, founding partner at Altimeter Group, and has worked with top tech and digital companies including Cisco, IBM, Visa.

We go way back with Jeremiah and we're eager for him to take the Main Stage at STEP 2020. Jeremiah founded Crowd Companies, which focuses on how large companies leverage the collaborative economy. He focuses on how social media, mobile, and IoT power the collaborate economy and impacts how companies stay relevant to customers. 

Fun facts! Jeremiah's twitter feed was named one of the top feeds by Time Magazine and he's actually a former professional jazz player! 

Early Bird tickets are on sale so get yours here before prices increase!

node.title: Waiting for the Jetsons life. Get Your STEP 2020 tickets
node.content:
We have more exciting speakers announced and confirmed coming to STEP 2020! 

Adah Parris takes a philosophical approach to technology, hones her skills in pattern recognition and creates immersive storytelling and learning and development environments. She's worked with global companies including Google, Unilever, Sainsbury's, Ogilvy Labs, The British Council, The EU Council, Burning Man Camp, and more. 

Jamil Asfour is joining us from the Abu Dhabi Investment Office where he is the Executive Director of Tech Partnerships and has worked with multiple companies in the US, China, and the Middle East. 

Both are joining the STEP X speaker line-up!

The preliminary agenda is out for STEP X and STEP 2020 with topics covering the future of Automotive Software, E-vehicles, Robotaxis, InsureTech, CleanTech, and the perspectives around AI. 

You only have 3 days left to get your Early Bird STEP X Pass or Early Bird MasterPass (gives you access to all the good stuff) so get yours here before prices increase!
node.categories: STEP 2020|Filters>Step X|Blog>Content & Speakers|2020 conference agenda Old>STEP X

node.title: Meet the Women Dominating STEP 2020 ‍
node.content:
Erica Kerner, Melissa Rosenthal, Adah Parris, Asma Shabab and Helen Chen are just a few of the strong speakers joining STEP 2020 this year.

Joining us at STEP Digital, is the Sr. Advisor at ONE Championship, Asia's largest Sports Media Property, Erica Kerner. She was also the VP of Marketing & Comms at Tiffany & Co. The Asia Pacific, and has more than 20 years of experience with other companies like Ralph Lauren, Adidas, Nike and more in the Asia Pacific.

Melissa Rosenthal, also joining the STEP Digital line-up, hails from the US. She was part of Cheddar, a live video media company, acquired by Altice USA for $200M. She's now co-founded Inspo, a text-tech publishing network. 

Joining us on STEP X is Adah Parris, who takes a philosophical approach to technology, hones her skills in pattern recognition and creates immersive storytelling and learning and development environments. She's worked with global companies including Google, Unilever, Sainsbury's, Ogilvy Labs, The British Council, The EU Council, Burning Man Camp, and more.

Asma Shabab, also joining the STEP X area, is the Digital Strategy Leader at IBM, UAE, and advises companies and governments on how technology can help them create a competitive advantage. With insights into the role of technologies such as artificial intelligence, the internet of things, blockchain and big data, Asma is uniquely placed to help organizations develop sustainable strategies that address disruption and future-proof their businesses.

Finally, joining us on Main Stage is Helen Chen, the CEO and Co-founder of Nomad, a property technology company in the Middle East. Prior to founding Nomad, Helen was an investor and worked at several notable companies including Goldman Sachs, China Investment Corporation (CIC), and Blackstone as well as studying at Stanford Business School. A strong believer in supporting women both in tech and in the boardroom, Helen is a champion for hiring female talent at Nomad and encouraging a balanced workforce.

Don't miss out on all the power at STEP 2020, and Get your Master Pass tickets here!

node.title: Eric Cheng, Co-founder, and CEO of Carsome will be Joining our Global Line-up this Year.
node.content:
Meet Startup Founders Scaling in Emerging Markets at STEP 2020!

Eric Cheng will be at STEP 2020 on our Main Stage to share his experience on scaling in emerging markets.

Carsome is a startup that was able to scale within six months of its launch and secure more than 3,200 participating dealers, sold more than 16,000 vehicles and received over 450,000 bids. Its series-B funding raised around $19 million USD earlier this year, and in turn, strengthened its presence in Indonesia and Thailand. *Sweet*

Get your Early Bird tickets here before ticket prices increase up to $100 dollars on January 11!

node.title: Success Story Alert of a Startup that Participated in Startupnight.
node.content:
Last year the startup SCROOSER showcased at our Startupnight, and one year later they were able to scale and succeed in their industry! Coincidence?

One of the most successful electric transport manufacturers in the industry, Kumpan electric, acquired SCROOSER electric scooter company.

Kumpan plans to expand SCROOSER’s by integrating developed technologies, like its own battery pack design. Moreover, Kumpan and SCROOSER have already sold 15,000 electric scooters, and the team foreshadows a significant growth in that number soon.

See SUN 2019's Recap Video here!

Don't forget to grab your Startupnight ticket here. If you already have a STEP 2020 ticket then you might get special access on a first-come, first-serve basis!

node.title: The Scobleizer!!!!
node.content:
Robert Scoble, one of the biggest tech journalists in Silicon Valley, who's interviewed the CEOs of Flipboard, Pantheon, Slack, Salesforce co-founder, and tons of other tech big shots, is coming to STEP 2020!!

Robert Scoble's blog, The Scobleizer, started rising to fame during his time at Microsoft, where he turned the tech company's image around. Scoble has created and led other blogs, TV, and online channels at Fast Company, Rackspace, and others. And if that wasn't enough, he is also the Chief Strategy Officer at Infinite Retina; and he's a spatial computing guru.

Scoble is also quite the entrepreneur with ventures of his own and will be taking the Main Stage at STEP 2020 so get your tickets now. 

Regular tickets are on sale so get yours here!

node.title: Let's Fly away to Dubai this February ✈
node.content:
Coming to STEP 2020 this February? Here is where you can find the best prices and most convenient flights to Dubai!

via GIPHY

No matter where you're coming from in the world, you will find the best flight timings, dates, and deals by taking a look at Tajawal and Wego.

These two handy channels can help you easily pick the airline that suits you from Emirates, Fly Dubai, MEA, Royal Jordanian, Air France, and many others on one platform.

Book your flights now to Dubai and join us at STEP 2020 this February to attend the leading technology festival for emerging markets!

Tickets for STEP 2020 are now on sale so hurry up and get yours here!

node.title: STEP Goes Global in 2020!
node.content:
The World in Dubai will bring together more than 8000 international attendees, 300 showcasing startups and influential speakers to Dubai Internet City.

STEP Conference, the leading technology festival for emerging markets, has launched its 9th edition under the theme of “the World in Dubai” to be held on February 11th and 12th in partnership with Dubai Internet City (DIC) and the Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (Dubai Tourism). STEP 2020 is expecting to attract over 8000 international attendees, 300 showcasing startups, and influential tech leaders and speakers discussing the latest topics and trends across key industries.

This year, programming will represent a world scope on technology in the emerging markets, featuring the latest innovations and highlighting the opportunities in the ecosystem. The event will take place at Dubai Internet City with a format of 4 main conference verticals: STEP Start, STEP Digital, STEP X, & STEP Money.  

Ray Dargham, CEO of STEP said: “I am very excited to launch STEP for its 9th consecutive year. We have witnessed the development of what started as a conference for entrepreneurs in the Arab world and the Middle East to grow exponentially in becoming a global STEP Conference in Dubai, attracting top speakers, startups, and influential investors from all over the world and specifically from the emerging markets across Asia and Africa. As we enter a new era for STEP next year, in line with Expo 2020 and Vision 2021, we plan to attract entrepreneurs, startups, and tech companies that could potentially expand to Dubai and impact our business and talent landscape. This could not have been done without our partnership with Dubai Internet City and newly signed collaboration with the Dubai Tourism as our Destination Partner.

Ammar Al Malik, Managing Director of Dubai Internet City said, “Supporting the entrepreneurship ecosystem is key to our mission in driving talent, innovation and economic growth in the region. Through our continued partnership with STEP, we are confident that together we can provide the right platform for knowledge sharing and expertise exchange, creating the ideal environment for creativity and growth. As a comprehensive tech community, we aim to bring state-of-the-art initiatives and strategies to build the next generation of start-ups. As our ecosystem develops, we look forward to seeing more local success stories coming out of our communities and graduating with global recognition.”

Issam Kazim, CEO – Dubai Corporation for Tourism and Commerce Marketing said: “We are pleased to partner with STEP this year and excited to welcome international visitors to attend the conference and experience the city. Dubai is increasingly putting a strong focus on developing a vibrant and empowering ecosystem for start-ups and entrepreneurs, with stakeholders across the public and private sectors collaborating to support their efforts to grow, innovate and become vital contributors to our economic growth. STEP offers the ideal platform for entrepreneurs and start-ups to bring forward the latest technologies and innovations and will cement the emirate’s position as a leading technology hub for start-ups looking to progress and succeed in their fields.”

STEP 2020 will feature talks and panels featuring leaders with global insights and experience launching and growing a range of companies including Jeff Hoffman, the successful entrepreneur, and CEO who built Priceline and acquired Booking.com among other travel companies; Charles Schreger, the former HBO Executive responsible for programming sales in key markets including the MENA region; Vinodh Bhat, the co-founder and President of Saavn, a consumer technology company that is the largest digital music/audio service for South Asians globally and Joel Ayala, co-founder of Class 5 Global who have made several investments in startups like Careem and startups across Latin America and Asia; Amit Chaudhary, the co-Founder of Lenskart from India; Daumantas Dvilinskas, who already founded several companies and is currently heading TransferGo, a high-growth purely-digital global money transfer service based in the United Kingdom;  Ben Harburg, Managing Partner of MSA Capital from China; and Erica Kerner, Senior Advisor at ONE Championship in Singapore amongst others. 

STEP has also confirmed programs with key stakeholders who will host activities within STEP Conference 2020, including Startupnight hosted by DubaiSME, bringing 60 startups from Europe across different sectors on a Dubai roadshow leading to a competition; and the Volkswagen Mobility Challenge, which is returning for the second edition presenting innovations and ideas aimed at changing the world of mobility.

STEP will also be back with a program of satellite events for curated networking, the annual startup pitch competition, Mentor’s Corner and Investor Meetings for 1-on-1 sessions with experts. 

Tickets for STEP 2020 are on sale now and can be purchased from the STEP 2020 website. 

About STEP

STEP is a millennial generation media company for young Arabs which focuses on technology and entrepreneurship, through dynamic and modern events, content, and media. STEP is mostly known for its flagship Step Conference which takes place annually in Dubai and Riyadh and gathers thousands of startups, entrepreneurs, and investors. STEP was listed as a Forbes top 100 startups in the Middle East and in the top 100 startups shaping the 4th industrial revolution by the World Economic Forum. 

About Dubai Internet City

Dubai Internet City (DIC), a member of TECOM Group, is a unique ICT hub and is the only specialised technology business community in the region, it is a place where innovators and entrepreneurs from all over the world work, connect and share their vision for a bold new tomorrow.

About Dubai’s Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (Dubai Tourism)

With the ultimate vision of positioning Dubai as the world’s leading tourism destination and commercial hub, Dubai Tourism’s mission is to increase the awareness of Dubai among global audiences and to attract tourists and inward investment into the emirate. Dubai Tourism is the principal authority for the planning, supervision, development, and marketing of Dubai’s tourism sector. It markets and promotes the Emirate’s commerce sector, and is responsible for the licensing and classification of all tourism services, including hotels, tour operators and travel agents. Brands and departments within the Dubai Tourism portfolio include Dubai Business Events, Dubai Calendar, and Dubai Festivals and Retail Establishment. 

Get your tickets here before prices increase.

For more information, please contact Mayssa Makhlouf at media@stepgroup.co or +971556479075

node.title: Introducing the STEP Wellness and Lifestyle Track ‍♂️
node.content:
We're launching our first edition of STEP Wellness and Lifestyle Track in 2020! *Vrikshasana pose* 

The STEP Wellness and Lifestyle Track will be covering topics on the wellbeing of our mind, body, and soul, as well as the latest trends in tech and lifestyle.

Influencers, startup founders in the lifestyle space, NLP specialists, nutritionists, and fitness and mental health coaches will take our outdoor stage and share their insights on how mental and physical wellbeing can become a part of our fast-paced modern lifestyle. ‍♂️

via GIPHY

Categories Will Be

Mind: Top wellness influencers and application developers such as Rima Bazzi and more will share stories on how they were able to design a platform that helps its customers relax and integrate themselves into a healthy mental state.

Body: Physical coaches and influencers from BARE DXB, Bia Warrior, SBSTRCT and more will talk about how they were able to turn fitness into their lifestyle, and how social media played a vital role in inspiring others to do so.

Soul: NLP specialists and psychologists will share their views on recreation and how we can be goal-oriented in a way that motivates us and increases our mental health. Speakers to be announced soon! *watch this space*

Tech and Lifestyle: Top fitness and wellbeing application executives from Inggez, YACOB, 8fit and more will join us and share their input on how tech development was able to facilitate a healthy lifestyle to their users.

Don't miss out on all this positive energy at STEP 2020, and Get your regular tickets here!

node.title: You Don't Want to Miss the Main Stage at STEP 2020.
node.content:
We're going global on the Main Stage at STEP 2020 this year with hundreds of influencers and experts as they take the stages! Not to mention 300+ showcasing startups, 8000 attendees, and more, over the 2 conference days. 

If you get a Regular Master Pass ticket here you'll get to watch this crew take the Main Stage at STEP 2020.

node.title: Check out the Founders, Investors & VCs on STEP Start!
node.content:
The home base for founders, startups, and entrepreneurs, check out the top global CEOs, VPs, Founders, and Investors on the Main Stage!

via GIPHY

Get your STEP Start tickets here to get the latest on Fundraising & Investments, Acquisitions, and IPOs, Setting up and Growth and everything else in the startup landscape from these top speakers:

1. Patrick de Laive - Co-founder and CPO of TNW (The Next Web), one of the world's largest online publications that deliver an international perspective on the latest news about Internet technology, business, and culture.

2. Walid Faza - Partner and COO at MSA Capital for MENA. With over 9 years of experience in the region's Venture Capital industry, Walid is responsible for investments and partnerships. Walid is also an advisor to many startups and has extensive managerial, leadership and mentorship expertise.

3. Pamela Attebery - Leads HSBC’s innovation agenda across the MENA region and Turkey, and oversees the Dubai Innovation Lab, aimed at transforming the bank’s products and processes.

4. Amit Chaudhary - Co-founder at Lenskart.com, an Indian optical prescription eyewear retail chain with over 500 stores in 70 cities in India and valued at $460-470 million. 

5. Walid Mansour - Managing Partner at MEVP with more than 15 years of experience in Venture Capital, strategy, corporate finance and engineering within the digital, telecom, software and new media industries. 

Get your Regular Master Pass ticket here and join the Main Stage at STEP 2020!

node.title: Brand Managers, CMOs & Influencers Take Over STEP Digital!
node.content:
The latest global trends in digital marketing, brands, advertising tech, and content from global Brand Managers, CMOs, Influencers, and digital gurus will be on the STEP Digital Stage!

via GIPHY

Get your STEP Digital tickets here to get the latest on from these top speakers:

1. Hamish Mc Pharlin - Head of Insight at BBC Global News, who tracks the health and consumption of the BBC News brand worldwide, using the latest in analysis technologies and data visualization techniques.

2. Erica Kerner - Sr. Advisor at ONE Championship – Asia’s largest Sports Media Property.

3. Charles Schreger - Former president of HBO Enterprises, currently teaches at NYU Stern School of Business and is a visiting professor at American University in Dubai.

4. Melissa and Jeff Cafone - Co-founders of Inspo, a text-tech and publishing network for Gen Z

5. Stephanie Atala - Actor and singer who has managed to gain a lot of support in the small time of starting her career.

Get your Regular Master Pass ticket here and join the Digital Stage at STEP 2020!

node.title: Catch Global Fintech & Future Tech Experts at STEP X & STEP Money!
node.content:
What would life look like by 2050? Join the experts at STEP X as they give us the latest on the future of transport and autonomous tech, smart cities, IoT, Artificial Intelligence, while over at STEP Money, we'll get what's happening in Fintech, blockchain, digital currencies, payments, lending, and wealth management, all on the Dubai Internet City STEP X stage!

via GIPHY

Get your tickets here before prices go up in less than 2 weeks and don't miss out on these global top speakers:

STEP X (Left to Right)

1. Karl Jeanbart - COO and co-founder of Derq, an award-winning MIT-spinoff with a mission to eliminate road accidents and save lives. In 2019 Derq won best AI startup at SXSW.
2. Adah Parris - a futurist, storyteller and cultural strategist, works with businesses and individuals in advertising, entrepreneurship, technology start-ups, and many more.
3. Jihad Tayara - CEO of EVOTEQ, a UAE-based solutions provider that delivered the largest municipal digital transformation project in the region and deploying Sharjah’s first blockchain. 
4. Asma Shabab - Digital Strategy Leader at IBM, UAE, and advises companies and governments to develop sustainable strategies that address disruption and future-proof their businesses.
5. Ayman Sharaiha - Co-Founder at Altibbi, the leading Middle East digital health platform, that aims at presenting reliable, up-to-date and simplified medical information to users in the region.

STEP Money (Left to Right)

  1. Loredana Manushaqa - Certified Blockchain Solution Architect as well as a Certified Blockchain Business Foundations professional. While holding a Master of Science in Blockchain Applications and Digital Currencies, she is also a researcher and educator in the sector.
  2. Dr. Daniel Diemers - Co-founder of Swiss Finance +Technology Association and Crypto Valley Association, member of fintechrockers.com, and associated with the international fintech and blockchain community.
  3. Jayesh Patel - Head of the fastest growing bank in the Middle East, responsible for the setup and launch of Liv; the first digital-only lifestyle bank.
  4. Daumantas Dvilinskas - A serial entrepreneur and advisor to startup founders, currently co-founder and CEO at TransferGo, which is an online alternative to banks to make international money transfers.

Get your Regular Master Pass ticket here and join us at STEP 2020!

node.title: Top Happenings at STEP 2020
node.content:
STEP Conference is known to be the biggest event for emerging markets, and this year it's bigger. Hold on to your hats and get ready for the top happenings at STEP 2020:

1) Top speakers

STEP Conference features the best and brightest speakers in the industry who share their knowledge and insights on our stage. This year we are lucky to welcome:

  • Robert Scoble
  • Jeremiah Owyang
  • Charles Schreger
  • Jeff Hoffman
  • Adah Parris
  • Erica Kerner

2) Main stage

Our Mainstage this year is going to be featuring speakers and sessions that are worth every minute.

Topnotch segments include:

  • Fireside: Global Ventures <> SpiderSilk
  • Fireside with Zeina El Kaissi from Smart Dubai
  • Asia's billion-dollar ecosystem
  • Government-Driven Innovation: Action and Policy

Keynote talks you don't want to miss out on:

  • The Perfect Storm of the 2020s: Spatial Computing by Robert Scoble
  • Journey of an Entrepreneur - Life and Legacy by Jeff Hoffman
  • Six Digital Eras by Jeremiah Owyang

3) VW Mentors corner

4) Pitch competition

5) SUN2020

6) Wellness Track

Success comes from a healthy and dedicated mind, body, and soul. That's why this year we are introducing the Wellness Track which features influencers, startup founders in the lifestyle space, NLP specialists, nutritionists, and fitness and mental health coaches, who share their insights on how mental and physical wellbeing can become a part of our fast-paced modern lifestyle.

7) Sponsored segments

8) Marketing Society Breakfast

9) Food and Entertainment

Honestly, if you haven't gotten your ticket yet, what are you waiting for?? Get your Regular Master Pass ticket here and join us at STEP 2020!

node.title: Startup Activities in store at STEP 2020!
node.content:
The STEP 2020 Startup Basecamp is going to be jam-packed with 300+ global showcasing startups leading on innovations across fintech, digitech, agritech, future tech and more.
Come check out their interesting products and solutions at the below startup programming activities and don't forget, one of these startups will be STEP's 2020 Flagship Pitch Competition winner!

1. STEP 2020 Startup Basecamp

Over 300 global startups will participate at STEP 2020’s Startup Basecamp across 4 conferences to showcase their products and services. Showcasing startups will get a chance to meet with regional investors and VCs, gather leads, and network with potential clients and partners

2. STARTUP NIGHT

For the second time in a row outside Germany, Startup Night Dubai will be held on February 11th at 5 pm at STEP 2020. The program is targeted at startups from six sectors, Transportation & Mobility, Aerospace, Energy efficiency, Medical & Health, ICT and Education. Tickets start at $10 to attend but STEP 2020 ticket holders get free access on a first come first serve basis.

3. Volkswagen Mobility Challenge Winner Announcement

STEP X Partner, Volkswagen, launched the Volkswagen Mobility Challenge 2.0 in October 2019 for UAE or KSA candidates that have an idea or early stage innovation aimed at changing the world of mobility. Out of the shortlisted candidates that entered the bootcamp, only 1 will be taking home the grand prize, who will it be? Join us at the winner reveal on Day 2 at STEP 2020! 

4. STEP 2020 Pitch Competition

Showcasing startups will be shortlisted to get the chance to participate at STEP’s flagship pitch competition to present their products and services to leading investors and industry experts. Make sure you don't miss the live pitching at STEP Start, on the Main Stage!

5. STEP Camp hosted by Endeavor

A new introduction this year for startups beyond those showcasing is the STEP Camp program to support early-stage startups by providing highly curated, one-on-one mentoring sessions with successful Endeavor Entrepreneurs and mentors.

6. STEP 2020 Mentor's Corner

Stay tuned for mentor and investor announcements on stepconference.com!

7. Dtec Tour

Dtec will be hosting a co-working space on event days and a selected number of people will be invited to go on a tour to check out their new campus!

8. Live Polling and 1 Minute Video

Our media partners, WAYA Media, will be doing a live polling on their platforms for the 3 shortlisted pitch competition startups and the winning startup will get a 1 minute produced video of their pitch worth over $1,000!

Don't miss out on the chance to explore all these opportunities at STEP 2020 and get your Regular Master Pass ticket here!

node.title: Meet Zeina El Kaissi from Smart Dubai & spiderSILK on the Main Stage!
node.content:
Two fireside chats to watch out for at STEP 2020! Book your agenda for the fireside chat with Zeina El Kaissi, Chief Digital Director at Smart Dubai, on February 11th and on February 12th with the founders of spiderSILK, Dubai-based cybersecurity firm, joining the Main Stage line-up at STEP this year.

Zeina El Kaissi is the Chief Digital Director at the Smart Dubai Office where she spearheads Dubai-wide strategies and implementations of disruptive technologies and the positioning of Dubai as a global and industry leader in the smart city field. She's helped launch the Dubai Blockchain Strategy in 2017 and has been leading its implementation since then. Currently, she's leading the implementation of the globally recognized award-winning Dubai Paperless Strategy which aims to digitize all city services saving residents time and money spent on paper and visits to Government centers.

spiderSilk is a Dubai-based cybersecurity firm, specializing in simulating the most advanced cyber offenses on your technology so you can build your best security defenses. Their “super-hackers” have uncovered threats that would have impacted over 120 million human beings in aggregate. 

via GIPHY

You only have 9 days left to get your Regular tickets here before ticket prices increase up to $50.

node.title: Meet the Hub71 & ADGM team at STEP 2020!
node.content:
Check out ADGM and Hub 71 speakers on the STEP Start track on the Main Stage!

Joining STEP 2020 to discuss how to identify globally scalable startups and strategies to invest in as well as how to keep up with the market changes, and shift from bureaucratic models to becoming more lean, mark your calendars to watch:

  • Martin Tidestrom - ADGM’s Director of Business Development. Martin and his team have developed a range of support initiatives to facilitate set-up, growth and the financing lifecycle for start-ups and SMEs in the UAE, and they work closely with leading stakeholders across the region and internationally enhance and boost the sector.
  • Ahmad Alwan - Head of Strategy and Corporate Development at Hub71. He's supported the strategic development and launch of Abu Dhabi Catalyst Partners, a $1bn fund launched at Abu Dhabi Global Market aimed at boosting opportunities in the Emirate and also supported Mubadala Capital’s Private Equity Funds team in evaluating investment opportunities globally.
  • Nader Museitif - Head of Business Development and Partnerships at Hub71, Nader focuses on building strong alliances with tech enablers across different sectors to enrich Hub71’s global ecosystem for startups. His experience spans across multiple regions - Europe, Middle East, and Africa, leading strategic growth activities for companies including Uber and Aramex.

You only have 7 days left to get your Regular tickets here before ticket prices increase up to $50.

node.title: Over $1B in funds will be present at STEP 2020
node.content:
Over $1B worth of funds estimated from global VCs and investors will be at STEP 2020!

Taking over the lead in creating billion-dollar companies to small-cap IPO markets for tech startups in emerging markets; join these investors from Asia-Pacific and China who are flying into Dubai just for STEP 2020:
Ben Harburg - the Managing Partner at MSA Capital, brings over 7 years of experience in the industry in China. MSA has successfully executed over 50 direct investments in TMT and healthcare companies.

Walid Mansour - Managing Partner at MEVP with more than 15 years of experience in Venture Capital, strategy, corporate finance and engineering within the digital, telecom, software and new media industries.

Ahmad AlNaimi - Sr. Principal at STV, the largest venture capital firm in the Middle East, where he is responsible for the end-to-end investment cycle including sourcing of opportunities and board memberships.

Zheng Yu Huang - Chairman of Yu Capital, an investment firm with focuses on education and healthcare. Zhengyu worked at Intel Corporation as a Managing Director and then served under President Obama as a White House Fellow and special assistant to the Administrator for US Agency for International Aid.

Hasan Haider - Partner at 500 Startups, the most active Venture Capital firm in the world, based in Silicon Valley, with 2,000+ investments in 50+ countries and $400m in AuM. Hasan heads up the firm's practice in the MENA region, with the Arabic speaking market being a core area of focus.

Walid Fazza - Partner and COO at MSA Capital for MENA. With over 9 years of experience in the region's Venture Capital industry, Walid is responsible for investments and partnerships. Walid is also an advisor to many startups and has extensive managerial, leadership and mentorship expertise.

Other Investors joining us at STEP 2020 are: 

  • Class5 Global
  • Wamda Capital
  • Dtec
  • Mubadala
  • ASA Ventures
  • Flat6Labs
  • Ibtikar Fund
  • IFC
  • Dubai Angel Investors
  • Global Ventures

And more!

You only have 6 days left to get your Regular tickets here before ticket prices increase up to $50.
node.categories: STEP 2020|2020 conference agenda Old>STEP Start|Blog>Content & Speakers

node.title: Handy Tools and Apps for STEP 2020!
node.content:
STEP 2020 kicks off on February 11th and these are the apps and tools you need to step up your networking game and navigate smoothly through the event!

1. STEP Conference 2020 app

The STEP Conference 2020 app is live on Android and iOS. Download here to view the agenda, sign up for workshops and activities happening at STEP 2020 and receive event updates and announcements! Make sure to turn on notifications on the app so you don't miss any event day announcements! 

2. STEP Match

Take your networking game to a whole new level at STEP Match! Use the Brella app for intent-based matchmaking powered by AI, and book 1-on-1 meetings with your top matches.
Download the app on android or iOS and start establishing new partnerships and find the best connections whether new client, hire, partner or startup!

3. TROOV app


Troov is a lost & found software that allows STEP 2020 attendees to report what they have lost or found, using this page!

How Troov works:

  • If you find an item during STEP Conference please drop it at the main registration team or to a Security team member
  • If you lose an item please fill out Troov form : try to be as specific as possible when describing it
  • If our algorithm identifies a match ⚡ you will receive an email notification 
  • You will be required to provide a security question to prove your ownership : give an information that you are the only one to know about your item  (e.g.upload a picture of you with your item, describe your mobile phone case...)
  • As soon as you will be authenticated, you will receive the information to recover your item ✅

4. Revolugo

Flying in to Dubai for STEP 2020? Check out the hotel booking platform here for hotel rates ideally located around the event.

5. Hologuide

HoloGuide is the app where users can connect with any city using AR & AI technologies to explore around and discover offers. Holodguide can be used at STEP 2020 to guide you through the event and optimize your experience!

6. Yanzo

Get your own personal concierge on your phone and download Yanzo for an easier lifestyle. Yanzo can help you check out tasks like paying bills, buying item. By just one small message!

node.title: UNDERSTANDING THE BASICS OF RAISING CAPITAL FOR YOUR STARTUP
node.content:
To take your startup to the next level, you’ll need external capital to really grow and scale. Once you’ve found investors, you’ll need to negotiate and complete the investment deal. Those investors probably have previous deal experience to draw on, but you may be navigating this path for the first time.

KNOW WHAT ARE YOU ASKING FOR

Investors will want to know how much money you want to raise. Deciding how much to raise is a balancing act. 

You could raise only what you need for next stage of your startup’s development. Raising a conservative amount means you’ll probably use it with care and your startup is not overfunded. But you should raise a little extra capital to give you enough headroom for unexpected costs. If you raise too little, you might have to run another investment round again soon, which will be hard work, time consuming and expensive. 

Or, you could try to raise as much as you can to so that your startup has enough money to scale and become profitable. You won’t have to fundraise too often and face the uncertainty of a future funding round, especially if the funding environment gets more difficult. But you need to know what you want the money for. Over-funding without a plan can lead to problems. Investors are likely to seek more advantageous terms the more you raise. 

Look at your monthly expenses, add in costs of hiring new employees, marketing, development and any other expenses that you anticipate and then update your monthly expenses. Then multiply the amount of your monthly expenses by how long you want the money to last for. 

INVESTORS AND VALUATIONS

How much you can raise in an investment round will also depend on how much the investors think your company is worth. 

You may be tempted to avoid raising too much money at your current valuation if you think that the company will be worth significantly more in the short to medium term. But the higher the valuation you push for, the tougher the terms investors will seek so they can achieve their desired returns.

The more high-risk the investment, the more equity investors will expect to get a meaningful return and to have a significant level of influence over your company.

The general approach taken by VCs and investors is that you should raise enough money to last 12-18 months. If you try and raise money more frequently than this, it will be hard to demonstrate that you are hitting milestones and to justify your new valuation for the financing round. 

KNOW WHAT INVESTORS ARE ASKING FOR

Preparation is key. Consider the investor’s valuation of your company and the level of dilution the founders and early investors will experience. Learn the founder-friendly terms that you should try to include in your term sheet and those investor-friendly ones of which you should be wary. 

Some of the favourable terms that VC investors typically seek include:

  • a liquidation preference (the right to be paid out first if the company is liquidated or sold)
  • the right to appoint a board member 
  • protective provisions which allow it to control some types of business decisions (e.g. a veto on declaring dividends)
  • anti-dilution protection to protect the investor’s percentage ownership of the company in future financing rounds
  • vesting schedules for founder shares 
  • implementing share incentive plans

Be wary of accepting terms that are too investor-friendly for your business in your Seed or Series A financing rounds, as investors in future financing rounds may seek to get the same terms. 

TERM SHEET 

A term sheet (Memorandum of Understanding, MOU or Heads of Terms) is a short document setting out the key commercial terms of the investment in user-friendly language. It includes some standard legal language about things like confidentiality and resolution of disputes and will state that the parties will enter into full agreements in future. Get legal advice to help you review the term sheet and negotiate the deal before you sign it – founders often make the mistake of speaking to lawyers after a term sheet has been signed.

The investor will usually prepare the term sheet for you to review, and many VCs have their own standard forms. You may need to evaluate different term sheets if you have various investors interested in funding your venture. 

DETAILED DOCUMENTS

After agreeing the term sheet, an investment deal usually involves a share subscription agreement, shareholders’ agreement and restated constitutional document (e.g. articles of association).

The investors will start the due diligence process when they will review and verify information about your company. The scope of review varies between investors and yours will send you a list of documents they want to review. 

Don’t expect this phase to be straightforward just because you’ve already negotiated the term sheet. The documentation is much more detailed and further negotiations are common on items that were left out of, or not agreed at, the term sheet phase and mechanical matters. This stage typically takes several weeks.

GETTING READY FOR THE CASH

You’ll agree the closing date with your investors when you will sign the documents and receive the money.  This date is usually a few days after agreeing the documents or is linked to the satisfaction or waiver of conditions (e.g. completion of outstanding due diligence, employment agreements with key employees and transferring intellectual property rights from founders and developers to the company). 

Send the final investment documents to everyone who needs to sign them in advance of the closing date.

Provide the company’s bank details to the investors in advance of the closing date so that they can set up the bank transfers to pay the purchase price for the shares to the company.

GETTING THE CASH

On completion, the investors pay the agreed purchase price for the shares to the company and the company issues shares to the investors. The parties also exchange the signed and dated original documentation (e-signature solutions, such as those provided by our partner, DocuSign,  can hugely increase the efficiency of the signing process).

After completion, there’ll be some housekeeping matters to attend to. These include updating the shareholders’ register of the company with the investors’ details and submitting any necessary notifications to the companies’ registrar.

…and breathe…before your next round!

By Patrick Rogers

Co-founder and CEO of Clara, a legal operating system that digitises and automates startup legal expertise. 

Clara empowers founders, ensures a startup’s venture-readiness and provides unmatched portfolio management and market intelligence to its investors. Clara is addressing pain points felt by startups and investors alike when it comes to startup legals – and is doing so on a global basis. 

Sign up today at www.clara.co and follow us on social media for all the latest updates! 

Twitter: @ClaradotCo

LinkedIn: Clara Technologies

node.title: DHL's Amadou Diallo is Coming to STEP 2020!
node.content:
He started out running a store at age 12. Now this CEO manages a team of 4,000

Amadou Diallo, CEO of DHL Global Forwarding Middle East & Africa and founder of Saloodo! GmbH is coming to STEP 2020!

Amadou has more than 25 years of experience in the tourism, banking, express, and logistics industries, and was previously Chief Executive Officer of Africa and South Asia Pacific DHL Global Forwarding and prior to this Chief Financial Officer of Deutsche Post DHL Logistics Divisions.

If you haven't gotten your Master Pass or STEP X tickets, get them now, here, to watch him on stage before prices go up in tomorrow!
node.categories: STEP 2020|Blog>Content & Speakers|2020 conference agenda Old>STEP X

node.title: What's next in the on-demand music and entertainment industries?
node.content:
We're experiencing a shift from broadcasting to on-demand in the music and entertainment industries, but how's the content being tailored and published? What did we witness in the 2010s and what should we expect in the 2020s?

via GIPHY

Mark your calendars for the "Streaming, Trending Upward" panel on February 11th on the STEP Digital stage with these experts:

Maaz Sheikh - CEO and Co-founder of STARZPLAY, the subscription video on demand service that streams to 20 countries across the Middle East and North Africa, leading the company’s corporate and operational activities to expansion across the MENA region.

Mike Fairburn - General Manager at Sony Music Entertainment. The label's head office in Dubai drives creative innovation for MENA talent through world class A&R, Creative Marketing & Promotions, Streaming and Global Distribution, Brand Partnerships and Live. 

Moe Hamzeh - Managing Director of Warner Middle East. He began his career in the music industry in 1998 as a Label Manager with Warner Music’s regional licensee at the time Music Master, overseeing the marketing & distribution in Lebanon. 

Jim Louderback - with a 20-year history of leadership at the intersection of publishing, media and technology Jim currently runs events business VidCon as an independent division of Viacom as CEO.

Get your tickets to meet them on the STEP Digital stage on February 11th!

node.title: Regular Tickets EXTENDED & Influencers Coming to STEP
node.content:
Regular tickets have been EXTENDED till February 9th at midnight!

Check out these influencers coming to STEP 2020 and get your tickets here now before prices go up!

Maaz Sheikh - CEO and Co-founder of STARZPLAY, the subscription video on demand service that streams to 20 countries across the Middle East and North Africa, leading the company’s corporate and operational activities to expansion across the MENA region.

Mike Fairburn - General Manager at Sony Music Entertainment. The label's head office in Dubai drives creative innovation for MENA talent through world class A&R, Creative Marketing & Promotions, Streaming and Global Distribution, Brand Partnerships and Live. 

Moe Hamzeh - Managing Director of Warner Middle East. He began his career in the music industry in 1998 as a Label Manager with Warner Music’s regional licensee at the time Music Master, overseeing the marketing & distribution in Lebanon. 

Jim Louderback - with a 20-year history of leadership at the intersection of publishing, media and technology Jim currently runs events business VidCon as an independent division of Viacom as CEO

Samia Kallidis - Fitness Coach at Orangetheory Fitness, co-founder of Bia Warrior, Ninja Warrior and Design Strategist with a passion for social impact. 

Jade Palmer - a ball of good vibes waiting to spread her energy wherever she goes, Jade works alongside Nike and has been able to explore, evolve, and discover how movement brings communities together both physically, mentally. 

Omar Chihane - Founder and CEO of englease.com and corporate veteran and growing social media personality with a deep understanding of building network power, having built a platform of over 1million followers across the MENA region in less than 11 months.

Tala Samman - One of the first bloggers to come out of the UAE, myfashdiary.com, brand ambassador for Breitling and partnered up with Net-a-porter, Bobbi Brown, Sephora and Pantene, Tala also serves as a content creator for thehuntr.com and Hello! Magazine and is a DJ!

Stephanie Atala - Actor, singer and influencer, Stephanie stars in feature films, on stage plays and TV appearances and hosts an online weekly show «Kazdoura» where she enjoys two of her favorite things: Comedy and Food.

node.title: Head of Video and Creative at TikTok is coming to STEP 2020!
node.content:
Apart from being one of the fastest growing social media platforms in the world which presents an alternative version of online sharing, TikTok is a completely new subculture.

Joining us on STEP Digital stage is Head of Video and Creative at TikTok, Rami Zeidan!

Rami is a marketer who has previously worked on building the Anghami Brand, the leading music streaming service in MENA and OMD before that, consulting for global brands like McDonald's, Visa, Pepsico, and GE.

Now, he's driving with a team of TikTokers on a mission to inspire creativity and bring joy through nurturing a wider creative community across multiple content disciplines such as Food, Fashion, Sports, Comedy, Music, Education, and more.

Get your Master Pass or STEP Digital tickets here to watch him on stage!

node.title: Dtec at STEP 2020
node.content:
Need a space to work at STEP?

Do you have an urgent call to attend or an email to send across?

Drop by at the Dtec booth, a pop-up coworking space for anyone who wishes to work while they attend the STEP Conference. Enjoy a new space of work while you can network and let some ideas flow while playing table football and a Buzz wire game.

Visit the largest tech startup ecosystem in MENA - tours

Our team at the Dtec booth will be registering for tours to visit the largest award winning tech startup ecosystem in MENA. If you are interested to visit and explore our hub now also located at the Dubai Digital Park, then drop by to register or email

Spaces are limited so make sure you book early.

The bus leaves at 3 pm on 11th & 12th from here and will return you to Internet City at approx. 6.30 pm

Interested in setting up a tech company in UAE?

Are you an aspiring entrepreneur who is looking to house their company in UAE? Then we have the best solution for you. Dubai Technology Entrepreneur Campus (Dtec), has a creative pop-up coworking space booth at STEP Conference. 

If you haven’t gotten your STEP 2020 tickets, get them now, here!

Meet the Dtec team at STEP

Looking to scale-up and short of capital? Meet the Dtec team, that can guide you around the UAE startup ecosystem, from setting up a company, to providing legal and financial advice on raising capital for your business. If you are at STEP, make sure you drop by the Dtec booth.

Dtec is a technology hub designed to support entrepreneurs through the provision of one-stop company setup. Spanning 10,000 sqm and with more than 800 companies from 72 countries Dtec is the largest ecosystem of entrepreneurs in the MENA region.  

More than just a space, Dtec offers its start-up community a range of events, trainings, mentorship and networking opportunities along with an in-house Venture Capital division. Dtec is also home to the only Intel® Innovation lab in the MENA region, “Intelak” Aviation & Travel Tech incubator and the Dubai Smart City Accelerator.

The Dtec community is supported by a large network of entrepreneurs, mentors, investors, support services and multinational companies including Microsoft, IBM, Volkswagen, and Refinitiv among many others. 

For more information visit www.dtec.ae, email dtec@dso.ae or call 04 501 5656.

node.title: STEP's Co-founder & CEO shares his favorite sessions happening this year at STEP 2020!
node.content:
"I’m usually excited about pretty much everything at STEP Conference every year but I’m always overly excited about a few things. Here is my list of things that I’m “overly” excited about for STEP 2020:" - Ray Dargham

  1. Step Match Brella Networking App: I’ve seen many networking tools and this is by far the best I’ve ever come across. I experienced it in San Francisco last year and we decided to bring it to Step. Make sure you download the Brella app or use the web link to get connected and schedule instant meetings with the right people at the conference. It’s really awesome.
  2. We’re bringing back the Main Stage with a global line-up of speakers from Silicon Valley, Europe, Africa, India, China, and beyond.
  3. Record Startup Showcase: We’re breaking our record this year by the number of startups showcasing which will be 300+ and the best part is that a lot of them are global.
  4. Wellness Track and Stage: We’re launching a whole new wellness track that will cover mind, soul, and body in life and at the workplace. This is becoming an increasingly important topic in startup ecosystems around the world.
  5. The Step Show: After the success of last year’s, we’re doing again the Step Show this year which is the first ever live talk show at a conference (let me know if you’ve heard of any others).
  6. STEP 2020 Opening Night: STEP's Opening Night concept is going to be a first for us this year! We will be hosting Opening Night at Cinema Akil and screening "Autonomy", a documentary on self-driving cars by journalist and author Malcom Gladwell. Seats are limited so only the first 100 STEP Ticket holders will get a seat so book yours now.

Get the chance to meet Ray and many other CEOs at STEP 2020 and get your tickets here now!

node.title: Microsoft at STEP 2020
node.content:
Check out what STEP Start Cloud Partner, Microsoft, has in store for you at STEP 2020!

Workshops: Get your Microsoft advantage today!

Join Muhammad Nabil, Head of ISVs and Startups Strategy at the Microsoft Office on February 11th & 12th at 2pm for a comprehensive global program designed to support startups as they build and scale their companies. Whether you’re looking to build your first application, land your first customer or scale to a million users, we’re here to help. From technical resources and free cloud to selling alongside Microsoft   salespeople and partner channel, we're invested in your success.

Keynote on X/Money Stage:

Public Sector Director, Leila Serhan will have a keynote "The Fourth Industrial Revolution: Digital Transformation" to discuss what are the implications of the fourth industrial revolution on us? How can you keep up in the agile digital world of cloud and artificial intelligence? On February 11th at 12:10pm on the DIC STEP X/Money Stage.

Hosted Panel:

Mark your calendars for the "Insurance: Still on the edge of disruption" panel hosted by Microsoft on February 11 on the DIC STEP X/Money stage to get insights on why many insurers are still hesitant to take bold, and fast steps towards transformation and the need and strategies to share risks and start adopting technological transformations such as the Internet of Things (IoT), blockchain-based infrastructure options, and mobile applications.

node.title: Are Robotaxis Achievable by 2023?
node.content:
CEOs like Elon Musk and Dara Khorosrowshahi are openly debating robotaxis and how soon they’ll hit the streets. When do you think that will be?

via GIPHY

We’re exploring this on the STEP X panel: 'Reality Check: Are Robotaxis achievable by 2023?’ with Robert Scoble and other mobility experts.

Robert Scoble - Founder of Infinite Retina and among the world's best-known technology strategists. He is also a keynote speaker and most passionate about Virtual and Augmented Reality and how they will change and disrupt business.

Karl Jeanbart - COO and co-founder of Derq, an award-winning MIT-spinoff with a mission to eliminate road accidents and save lives. Derq was founded in Dubai in 2016, in 2017 was selected to join the prestigious Techstars Mobility accelerator in Detroit, and in 2019 won Best AI startup at SXSW.

Zohaib Ali - Founding member of Airlift Technologies, a smart-bus solution designed to cater to the mass transit market, and has raised the region’s largest Series A round (USD 12 Million) in record time.

Get your tickets and meet these masterminds at the Dubai Internet City STEP X stage on February 12th at STEP 2020!

node.title: Everything You Need to Know for STEP 2020!
node.content:
STEP 2020 kicks off on February 11th on the Main Stage at 9:30 AM.

The Full Agenda Can Be Found on the Website Here. 


Opening Night

Join us at Opening Night on February 10 at 6pm at Cinema Akil, Alserkal Avenue, for the screening of “Autonomy” and let the networking and connections start the evening before the conference starts! Seats are limited so only the first 100 STEP Ticket holders will get a seat so book yours now.

It will also be your chance to pick up your badge to avoid the registration lines in the morning.

STEP After

Come wrap up STEP 2020 with us at La Mezcaleria where there’s a mix of Latin and Beirut vibes over food and drinks. And it’s a reason to enjoy the last of the city before you fly out of Dubai.

Make sure to RSVP here

Parking:

  • There are 3 parking options:
    • Option 1: Valet between buildings 1 & 2 at AED 40/day 
    • Option 2: Valet at building 6 at AED 40/per day
    • Option 3: Free self-parking at Dubai Media City Multi-Story Parking, 5th floor

Getting to the Venue:

  • If you are taking a taxi, there is a pickup/drop off available at the main entrance: Between Building 1 & 2, Dubai Internet City
  • If you are taking the metro, Nakheel Metro station is the closest to the venue. 20 mins walk 
  • If you are taking the tram, Palm Jumeriah tram station is the closest to the venue. 10 mins walk
  • Shuttle bus available on the ground floor of the Dubai Media City Multi-story parking. The shuttle bus will bring you straight to the main entrance!

Event App:

  • Download STEP Conference app on Android or iOS here to sign up for workshops and activities happening at STEP 2020, network with attendees, and receive event updates and announcements! 

STEP Match:

  • Take your networking game to a whole new level at STEP Match! Use the Brella app for intent-based matchmaking powered by AI, and book 1-on-1 meetings with your top matches.
    Download the app on android or iOS and start establishing new partnerships and find the best connections whether new client, hire, partner or startup!

Registration (Badge Pick-Up):

  • Pick up your badges starting on February 10th at Opening Night or both mornings of February 11th and 12th right at the STEP Main Entrance here.

node.title: STEP Conference 2020 ends with Multimillion Dirham Deals
node.content:
Held in its 9th edition under the theme of “the World in Dubai”, STEP Conference, the leading technology festival for emerging markets, just concluded with over AED 600 million worth of funding deals announced between companies, regional and homegrown startups. 

The two-day event drew 7000 visitors with a total of 300 international and local exhibitors from 24 countries and 200 speakers taking part in the event. This reflected the innovation, growth and investment in technology and disruption across the emerging markets and reinforces Dubai’s status as the top destination for entrepreneurs to build and grow their businesses.

Ray Dargham, Founder & CEO at STEP, said: “One of the best things about this year’s STEP Conference is breaking our record with 300 showcasing startups from all over the world. We are also proud to have several funds and startup investments announced at STEP 2020.”

Ammar Al Malik, Managing Director of Dubai Internet City, added: “Over the last nine years, STEP has evolved into one of the largest and most exciting tech festivals in the region, and as a strategic partner, we are extremely proud to have contributed to its growth. Continuing the success of previous years, the 2020 edition of STEP, a proven hot bed for entrepreneurs, start-ups and investors, was a great way for DIC to kick-off its plans for the year and reiterate its notable economic contributions to the UAE and beyond. 

“This year, DIC hosted ‘Float Your Pitch’ competition, and the response received was remarkable and earmarked another great event for us.”

Some of the key announcements from the conference were:

New investment platform Nuwa Capital was launched by managing partner Khaled Talhouni and is targeting up to USD$ 100 million in commitments in emerging markets, primarily covering the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) including KSA and UAE, East Africa, Pakistan and Turkey. Khaled Talhouni, Managing Partner at Nuwa Capital said: "We are at a pivotal moment for the ecosystem, where beyond capital, it has never been so important to provide founders with the right mentors, partners and operators, dedicated to helping them navigate the region's complex operating environment, and that is the vision behind Nuwa. Year after year, STEP continues to be MENA's hallmark event for startups, investors and other main stakeholders of the industry, and we as Nuwa Capital were very glad to have launched at the heart of the ecosystem." 

Vezeeta, Middle East and Africa’s leading digital healthcare platform secured US$ 40 Million in its Series D round led by Gulf Capital, the Middle East’s largest and most active alternative asset management firm. The round had strong support from existing investor, Saudi Technology Ventures (STV), who led Vezeeta’s Series C round in September 2018.

Okadoc, the leading instant doctor appointment booking platform, closed its $10 million Series A round, following a $2.3 million seed round in 2018. The latest fundraising round is the largest heathtech Series A in MENA. 

EAT app, a Dubai-based online restaurant reservation platform used throughout the Middle East, has raised a $5 million Series B round of funding led by 500 Startups and Derayah VC. This brings EAT’s total amount of money raised to $9.2 million.

Other key highlights from the conference:

  • Shorages, a simple e-commerce storage and fulfillment services for small and media companies, won the Volkswagen Mobility Challenge.
  • Wamda, the Middle East's startup ecosystem enabler, launched its 'The state of the pre-seed startups in MENA' report in collaboration with STEP Conference at the event on 11 February 2020.
  • Dubai Chamber Market Access program took place on sidelines of STEP where corporates such as EmiratesNBD and Mediclinic amongst others were matched with startups. 
  • Top conversations were led by H.E Khalfan Belhoul, moderated by Fadi Ghandour; the Head of Emerging Technology and Global Partnerships at the Smart Dubai Office, Chief Digital Director Zeina El Kaissi and H.E. Henrik Landerholm, Ambassador of Sweden.
  • Khadoum, an app that enables users to unlock a set of missions presented in the form of volunteer ideas and community challenges, won the STEP pitch competition
  • Amna Al Qubaisi, the first female Emirati racing driver joined STEP Show.

Sign up now for STEP 2021 here
node.imagecaption: DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES - 11 February 2020: STEP Conference. (Photo by Dan Taylor - ©Dan Taylor).|

node.title: Top Things that Happened at STEP 2020
node.content:
With our 9th edition of STEP Conference, themed “the World in Dubai”, wrapped up, here's a look at some of the key highlights/takeaways. What were your favorite moments?

Over AED 600 million worth of funding deals were announced between companies, regional and homegrown startups such as:

Vezeeta, Middle East and Africa’s leading digital healthcare platform, secured US$ 40 Million in its Series D round led by Gulf Capital

Okadoc, the leading instant doctor appointment booking platform, closed its $10 million Series A round.

EAT app, a Dubai-based online restaurant reservation platform used throughout the Middle East, raised a $5 million Series B round of funding led by 500 Startups and Derayah VC.

2. STEP Startup Basecamp 2020 breaks record with 300 showcasing startups

3. Top speakers from US, Europe & Asia such as Robert Scoble, Jeremiah Owyang, Adah Parris, Erica Kerner, Charles Schreger, Amit Chaudhary and more were on stage.

4. Launch of new investment platform: Nuwa Capital

5. Byton, China's up-and-coming electric car startup, exhibited at STEP

6. DIC Floating Pitch Competition

7. Shorages, a simple e-commerce storage and fulfillment services for small and media companies, won the second edition of the Volkswagen Mobility Challenge.

8. Spotify's 3D audio experience

9. Wamda, the Middle East's startup ecosystem enabler, launched its 'The state of the pre-seed startups in MENA' report in collaboration with STEP Conference at the event on 11 February 2020.

10. Dubai Chamber Market Access program took place on sidelines of STEP where corporates such as EmiratesNBD and Mediclinic amongst others were matched with startups. 

11. Top conversations were led by H.E Khalfan Belhoul, moderated by Fadi Ghandour

12. Head of Emerging Technology and Global Partnerships at the Smart Dubai Office, Chief Digital Director Zeina El Kaissi.

13. H.E. Henrik Landerholm, Ambassador of Sweden.

14. Khadoum, an app that enables users to unlock a set of missions presented in the form of volunteer ideas and community challenges, won the STEP pitch competition

15. Amna Al Qubaisi, the first female Emirati racing driver joined the STEP Show.

16. Sameh Saleh, Founder & CEO of Harmonica, announces new name for app: Hawaya

Sign up now for STEP 2021 here.

node.title: What to look out for at STEP 2020
node.content:
Here's what to look out for tomorrow at STEP 2020 Day 1:

1. Pick up your badges starting on February 10th at Opening Night or both mornings of February 11th and 12th right at the STEP Main Entrance here. 

2. STEP 2020 kicks off at 9.30am on the Main Stage with an opening with Ray Dargham, STEP Co-Founder & CEO. 

3. Download the event app on iOS or Android here. 

4. There are 3 parking options

  • Option 1: Valet between buildings 1 & 2 at AED 40/day 
  • Option 2: Valet at building 6 at AED 40/per day
  • Option 3: Free self-parking at Dubai Media City Multi-Story Parking, 5th floor. *7 min walk to venue*

5. If you're not driving, use this Hala Taxi code: STEP2020

There are tons of interactive activities and sessions to lock-in:

  • STEP Flagship Pitch Competition shortlisting round 1 at the Main Stage at 10.30 am 
  • Investor Meetings at 10.30 - 12.30 in Workshop Room 2

  • Volkswagen Mentor's Corner: all day sessions at VW Space

  • Dance Fitness at 3.20 on the Wellness Stage
  • Startupnight at 5pm at the Main Stage

It's gonna be a crazy day!

node.title: Top 5 Questions When Choosing Your First Cloud Platform
node.content:
Startups! We know that choosing your first Cloud platform might be tricky and often you think of your current state instead of your future state, and fail to consider what happens when you start gaining traction and scaling.

We've put together top 5 key questions that need to be considered to avoid Cloud migration, unwanted costs and lost time:

1. Where are my target customers or users located?

Your customers' location can impact network latency and how your application performs for your users. If there are no data centers near your customers, there is a risk that your application does not perform well for them. And if there is, are the core Cloud services that you need for your application offered or available in that region?

Next, you need to be aware of compliance regulations for the countries in which your user or customer are. For example, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) prohibits transferring data on EU residents outside of the EU. As a result, you may need to consider a Cloud platform that provides compliant services.

2. What open-source solutions or tools are my engineers using?

Your startup may be using one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, Node.js, Java, .NET, Ruby, etc.). You need a Cloud platform that offers SDKs available for the languages your startup is using - it'll make development faster when integrating your application with Cloud services.

Also, many startups use free or open-source databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, MongoDB etc. Make sure to store, query, tune, manage, and optimize performance by comparing and seeing which Cloud platforms have the best capabilities for optimizing your database: built-in backup and restore; ability to scale in seconds to meet the most demanding spikes; and advanced monitoring and alerting.

3. What is the cost of Cloud services?

Yes, a Cloud platform may have all the services that you need, but as a startup, can you afford it? Take the time to cost out what you expect to spend; most Cloud providers have a cost calculator you can use to make rough estimates. Are there some workarounds available to you, like using other technologies? For example, you could use a serverless execution pipeline like Azure Data Factory to run your Big Data jobs. These solutions are often much more cost-effective because you're not charged so much for compute and not charged when they are not in use.

These costings are also useful to know when pitching to investors when you're trying to raise capital!

4. Does the Cloud provider have excellent Customer Service and documentation?

No matter how good a Cloud provider is if they do not provide excellent Customer Service, Documentation or YouTube tutorials then run! Let’s face it; as a startup, you probably do not have the privilege to pick up the phone and call a Cloud provider whenever you run into an issue or have questions. So, it’s critical to do a quick POC of your application on the Cloud platform. This POC gives you insight into how good their documentation and tutorials are and how easy the platform is to use. If you get unlucky and run into issues or questions, examine how responsive and helpful their online support center is. This response gives you insight into what your future business dealings with the Cloud provider are likely to be. As a startup, you need a quick to market solution for your revenue and customers, delays from a Cloud provider equal delays in your product or feature release.

5. How are Disaster and Recovery handled?

As a startup, you need to protect your business from unplanned events ranging from human error, transient hardware failures, network or power outages, and even natural disasters and so on. Bad is your application being down in this circumstance, even worse is losing customer data. Even with backups, how long will your users or customers experience downtime before the application is back up and running? As a startup you need to evaluate the replication options of your resources; the cost to store the backups, service-level agreements (SLA), and automated tools that are in place to back up and restore your application when there’s an issue. Comparing all these factors for different Cloud Platforms is essential.

There... we've laid it all out for you... Now check out what digiteam had to say about Microsoft's support here!

node.title: hfdjifjdi
node.content:
Guys, 

The Coronavirus hasn’t spared the startup communities. Founders are anxious about the consequences of sweeping lockdowns and restrictions and are hardly managing to stay afloat and keep their staff onboard. What can be done to combat the unprecedented conditions which can easily lead to a damaging recession? Are there funds being offered for startups to work on solutions as a response to the emergency situation?
On April 7th, we're bringing Fadi Ghandour of Wamda Group and Rabea Ataya of Bayt.com together virtually to share insights, war stories, but most importantly answer your questions and help you tackle some of the tough things and uncertainties you're facing. Both Fadi and Rabea have been in the region during times of economic and social crisis and have faced several challenges in the most difficult times and have seen things through. 

Besides the chats and Q&A, you'll be able to network with each other. Ask questions to each other, find potential collaboration opportunities, share tips on how to help.

6:00 PM- 6:30 PM : Check-In & Online Networking
6:30 PM -7:00 PM : Chat with Fadi and Q&A 
7:00 PM -7:15 PM : Online Networking Break
7:15 PM -7:45 PM : Chat with Rabea and Q&A
7:45PM - onwards : Online Networking

node.title: STEP Conference Goes Online
node.content:
The largest tech festival for emerging markets takes its full experience online. 

STEP Conference, the leading technology festival for emerging markets, has launched STEP Anywhere to take place on August 24, 25, and 26. In its first edition, STEP Anywhere 2020 is expecting to attract over 3000 international attendees, 200 showcasing startups, and influential tech leaders and speakers discussing the latest topics and trends across key industries.

Since the escalated outbreak of Covid-19, event organizers have been impacted with hundreds of events getting canceled globally or postponed until further notice, while all stakeholders who would have participated including speakers, sponsors, exhibitors, attendees have also been affected. 

With the trend of hosting virtual webinars currently and adapting to digital trends, STEP will be bringing the STEP Conference experience online with this new event as a full-fledged conference with multiple stages hosting talks and panels; workshops; networking; exhibition and showcasing by startups, corporates, brands; startup programming including mentorship sessions, investor meetings, a pitch competition; and entertainment.  

Ray Dargham, CEO of STEP said: “We’re very bullish on online and virtual events and our first large scale online event will be here to stay. We are living in a transformational time in our industry. Step Anywhere will become one of our flagship annual events.” 

STEP Anywhere will feature talks and panels covering the latest tech trends in healthcare, education, finance, last-mile delivery, streaming, digital media, which are all among the most important industries with disruption and growth potential given the current global situation. Speakers will include..

Registration is open for Step Anywhere 2020 on anywhere.stepconference.com. 

--

About Step:

Step  is a millennial generation media company which focuses on technology and entrepreneurship, through dynamic and modern events, content, and media. STEP is mostly known for its flagship Step Conference which takes place annually in Dubai and Riyadh and gathers thousands of startups, entrepreneurs, and investors. STEP was listed as a Forbes top 100 startups in the Middle East and in the top 100 startups shaping the 4th industrial revolution by the World Economic Forum.

node.title: Announcing 'STEP Anywhere'
node.content:
Today’s announcement is the most excited I’ve been about an announcement in a while. You are going to experience a full-fledged STEP Conference online event this August for the first time. And we’re calling it 'STEP Anywhere'. 

As much as we love throwing amazing physical events that we’ve got you used to over the years, there is a lot that we can do with online events that simply wasn’t possible before: 

  1. Access: Many people in our community have been following us for years but simply couldn’t afford to attend our event physically. This has been the case especially for those in markets with lower purchasing power where the cost of a flight, hotel, and conference ticket would break the bank. Now, this access is possible for anyone anywhere at a very affordable cost. 
  2. Data: With data and tech, we will be able to massively improve our attendees and sponsors' experience at our events. In an online event, we’ll be able to connect you with the right people that you are looking for and not waste your time. 
  3. Waste: I’m a big fan of anything that reduces carbon emissions and waste for the environment. If we learned anything during this time, it would be the realization of how much nature is stronger than us all and we need to be nice to it. Physical events produce tons of waste in terms of plastic, wood, fuel, and so much more. This can all be saved with online events. 

Our first online event that we hosted in April was just “scratching the surface”. STEP Anywhere will be an online event experience that you’ve never seen before and probably orders of magnitude better than our first online event. 

STEP Anywhere will be a completely online conference experience with tons of sessions across several tracks/stages, multiple networking activities, exhibition and sponsor areas, satellite events, and much more. Thousands of startup founders, investors, and others who work in the tech and digital world will be in attendance.

Get your promo code here to get the earliest and cheapest ticket available.
